Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Geylang West Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Geylang West Constituency** was an electoral constituency in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It used to exist from 1959 to 1988 where it was absorbed into [Jalan Besar GRC](/wiki/Jalan_Besar_GRC). ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member of Parliament****Party**[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1959**[Yong Nyuk Lin](/wiki/Yong_Nyuk_Lin)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1963**[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**[Yong Nyuk Lin](/wiki/Yong_Nyuk_Lin)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972****1976****1979**[Teh Cheang Wan](/wiki/Teh_Cheang_Wan)**1980****1984** ## Electoral results Note : [Elections Department Singapore](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) do not include rejected votes for calculation of candidate's vote share. Hence, the total of all candidates' vote share will be 100%. ### Elections in 1950s [General Election 1959](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election)
